3: It took you and the others ten minutes to reach Camu.
As soon as Liv is done with Camu's emergency repairs, Camu pulls himself up, trying to go after Roland.
I advise you to calm down.
You can't stop me.
Not that I'm planning to, but if your frame breaks down, Kamui will be goner than gone.
You must know this deep down. Even if you wish to do battle, you must hand Kamui's frame out first.
...You're just like what the Kurono reports say. Well then, I have a proposal.
...What is it?
Kamui's frame must be sent back with his closed-off M.I.N.D. for a thorough examination. You are placing Kamui at risk every second you stay in his frame.
At the same time, I know I can't stop you from going after Roland to settle scores, so I have a proposal—You return Kamui's frame, and I'll help you go after Roland in another way.

Through Nikola's connections, we have fortunately found a frame that syncs well with your M.I.N.D. The performance might be slightly sub-par, but your functions will be relatively stable in it—in theory.
You'll need some extra modifications to use it long-term, but for now, it can still handle around ten days of combat.
You can't keep fighting with Kamui's frame, so you can have this instead. You go do whatever you want with this frame, while I figure out how to fix Kamui.
Watch out! High energy reaction from above!
What is Asimov even thinking, firing an airdrop from a railgun?!
Specialized pod to withstand the impact. No faster way to get a frame and a surgery cabin delivered in an hour.
What are you waiting for? I can perform the operation remotely, but you still have to connect to the transfer device yourself.
Will Kamui be okay?
I'm a scientist. We don't speak in absolutes.
But, compared to the Ascendants and Kurono, I think we'd be at least a little more trustworthy... My personal opinion, of course.
Camu pouts, then pushes the crowd away and stomps toward the surgery pod.
...I think Kamui told me some stuff about you. Name's Asimov, yeah?
...Oh? What did he say?
'Guy's a weirdo. Only ever talks about tech and theory.'
'Might not be fun guy. But def' not a bad guy.'
Camu extracts the connection cable from the pod and points it at the port on his frame.
Sounds too optimistic for me, but I guess I can try believing in him.
...Trusting people willy-nilly. Sure gets on my nerves.
Hah. Sure.
Camu links the connection cable to his data port and sits on the ground, as if asleep.
I can't promise you Kamui will be ok, but I've never let anyone down before. And I'd like to keep that record.
Some time passes...
【kuroname】.
Move Kamui's body away and open the drop pod door.
Okay. How's it feel having your very own body for once?
...Exactly the same as before.
Good. The frame is adjusted according to your data in Kurono.
Camu steps out of the airdrop cabin, moving and stretching his body. He then lifts his greatsword.
Let's go. No time to waste.
Wait! After switching into a new frame, you have to...
Just give up. You can't stop the guy.
Load him into the drop pod and press that blue button. It will return to a transport craft.
The transport craft is set to return to Babylonia when it receives Kamui's frame. You can now go back to what you were doing.
